intro: Entrecasteauxia australis, commonly known as the Australian entrecasteauxia, is a small, herbaceous plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in spring. It is adapted to dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal and inland regions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
